word:
South Lancaster, Sunday, October 26, 1890 

     I have not been able to sleep since three o'clock. I arose and indulged in a bath, then tried to see if I could sleep; but no, I have too much thinking to 


                                 -15- 

do. I dressed and then enjoyed a precious season of prayer, and have been writing since four o'clock. It is now half past six. . . .
